events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of June 1st and filed the initial claim for damages.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the vehicle collision incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claimant’s case and ensure all required processes are followed.
The customer was officially notified that the claim has been received and acknowledged by the insurance company.
Additional documentation including police reports, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates were requested.
The claimant has submitted all requested documents, including the police report and detailed repair invoices.
An investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence to determine fault and extent of damages.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of liability and verification of vehicle damage assessment.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer outlining the compensation amount for repair costs and damages.
The customer provided feedback expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and ease of communication.
The insurance company approved the claim based on the investigation results and the agreed settlement proposal.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued to the claimant’s bank account to cover vehicle repair expenses.
The claim case was officially closed after successful payment issuance and the claimant’s acceptance of settlement.
